name: MDLGeometryType
desc: Types of geometric primitives for rendering a submesh, used by the geometryType property.

items.name: case points
items.desc: Each index in the submesh refers to a vertex to be rendered as a single point.

items.name: case lines
items.desc: Each pair of consecutive indices in the submesh refers to two vertices to be rendered as a line segment.

items.name: case triangles
items.desc: Each set of three consecutive indices in the submesh refers to three vertices to be rendered as a triangle.

items.name: case triangleStrips
items.desc: The first three consecutive indices in the submesh refer to three vertices to be rendered as a triangle. Each subsequent index refers to another vertex that completes a triangle formed by connecting it to the previous two vertices.

items.name: case quads
items.desc: Each set of four consecutive indices in the submesh refers to four vertices to be rendered as a quadrilateral.

items.name: case variableTopology
